Description: DescriptionSafety ManagerGrade: GG12Location: RiyadhJOB PURPOSEBAE Systems is the UK Government’s nominated Prime Contractor under the Government-to-Government arrangements that are in place to provide equipment, support and training to Saudi Arabia.We provide maintenance of Royal Saudi Air Force aircraft and train RSAF personnel safely in a training environment in how to use their aircraft, equipment and weapons.BAE Systems Saudi Arabia is committed to supporting the Saudi Arabian National Agenda including Saudisation and the training and development of Saudi National capability through the growth of the Saudi National Partner Companies thereby reinforcing Industrialisation and Partnerships.JOB ACCOUNTABILITIESThe Job Holder is primary responsible as the Safety Manager for supporting the Head of Safety. The Safety Manager is responsible in the design, implementation and governance of the Safety & Environmental Management System (SEMS) for safe operations.This includes specific responsibility for the management of an up to date Safety & Environmental Management Plan, which provides a suite of relevant procedures and processes that demonstrate the implementation of the wider Safety and Environmental Management System (SEMS).As the most senior Safety and Environmental representative at project, the Job Holder will be required to provide guidance to all areas of the project’s operation to ensure that all safety risks associated with operations meet the safety and environmental requirements within the timescales, quality standards and budgets set for the project.The job holder will represent BAE Systems Saudi Arabia on all safety matters relating to project’s operations at; including management of project’s interfaces with the Customers, suppliers and sub-contractors.The Job Holder will be required to hold a level of Delegated Engineering Responsibility from. The job holder will ensure that the appropriate level of Safety & Environmental Management processes, standards and assurance activities are applied effectively across the contracted operation.As
